trial_identification.studytitle: Randomised Controlled Trial comparing Ceramic-on-Metal and Metal-on-Metal arthroplasty bearing surfaces - functional outcomes and serum metal ion levels following total hip arthroplasty
trial_identification.scientifictitle: An evaluation of ceramic-on-metal versus metal-on-metal bearing surface on functional scores, serum metal ion levels and radiological parameters in patients receiving total hip arthoplasty

conditions.healthcondition: Hip Osteoarthritis / Total Hip Joint Replacement

interventions.interventions: Both arms of the study involve total hip joint replacement - performed with cementless implants (Pinnacle acetabular shell with Ultramet metal insert with a Corail cementless femoral stem). The patient will then be randomised to receive either a ceramic (biolox) or metal (ultamet) femoral head. Operation time is estimated at 60 minutes.
interventions.comparator: Both arms of the study involve total hip joint replacement - performed with cementless implants (Pinnacle acetabular shell with Ultramet metal insert with a Corail cementless femoral stem). The patient will then be randomised to receive either a ceramic (biolox) or metal (ultamet) femoral head. Operation time is estimated at 60 minutes.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Serum Metal Ion levels - Cobalt and Chromium

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Overall hip joint evaluation measured by University of California at Los Angeles (UCLA) activity score, Harris Hip Score, and Oxford Score

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Patients clinically suitable for a 'hard-on hard' total hip replacement bearing surface Primary total hip arthroplasty
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Contra-lateral hip arthroplasty with a metal-on-metal bearing surface. Chronic Renal Failure

trial_design.concealment: Allocation involves contacting the holder of the allocation sequence who is 'off-site'
trial_design.sequence: A randomisation sequence has been prepared in advance using computerised sequence generation . The sequence includes a treatment allocation stratified by surgeon.

ethicsAndSummary.summary: This randomised controlled study of 80 patients receiving total hip joint replacements aims to compare the post operative serum metal ion levels, functional outcomes and radiological parameters of ceramic-on-metal and metal-on-metal bearing surfaces. All patients will receive the same acetabular component (Pinnacle) and femoral stem (Corail) with only the femoral head component been randomised to either a biolox cermic head of ultamet metal head. Results at 6,12,24 and 60 months will be compared.
ethicsAndSummary.publication: A prospective, randomised controlled trial comparing ceramic-on-metal and metal-on-metal bearing surfaces in total hip arthroplasty. JBJS(B) Nov 2012, 1462-1469.
